result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Addison V Ball

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Addison V Ball appeared by video.  Attorney Annette Rauch appeared on behalf of Christopher Lee Hartley by video for Addison V Ball.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense advised the court that this case is on track to be admitted to Veterans Treatment Court and requests a status conference date. State confirms posture and has no objection to the requests. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Addison V Ball in court with Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 069445,
Payable Number: 1021502,
Receipt Number: 22RP029643,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Addison V Ball in court with attorney Annette E Rauch.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-30-2022 @1p
